alert.note: Alert for Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 23 at 2:05PM MST until January 24 at 8:00AM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations of 1-3 inches between 7000-7500 feet with 2 to 5 inches above 7500 feet. * WHERE...Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet and West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Between 7000-7500 Feet. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
